content.question: A car is initially at rest and driven along a straight road with a constant acceleration <math alttext="a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi></math>. The car has a velocity <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math> when it has traveled a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>. A second car starts from rest on the same road and has an acceleration <math alttext="3 a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>a</mi></math> until it reaches the same final velocity. How far does the second car travel?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
